title: Carney should be asked to stay on. There’s no-one better for this time
text:
Should we not have had a new governor of the Bank of England announced by now? Mark Carney, the incumbent, is due to leave at the end of January. Etiquette demands that the world knows in good time who is going to replace him.

And yet answer comes there none. Like so much else, the matter has been subsumed by Brexit. Shortlists have been drawn up, potential candidates interviewed and recommendations made, but either because they are too busy on Brexit, or because they are afraid to make the decision, ministers have sat on their hands.

One explanation is that it is regarded as very bad form to make such an important appointment in what is in effect an election period. OK, so legally we are not...
description: Should we not have had a new governor of the Bank of England announced by now?
